items.title: Live: Can Nifty defend 23,500 on expiry day? | Adani stocks, UPL in focus | Opening Bell
items.description: India's trading session will resume after a day's holiday on account of Maharashtra elections. The previous session was marked with a topsy turvy trade where both Sensex and Nifty shaved off a percent gains from day's highs as Ukraine struck US-made missiles into Russia for the first time. However, Nifty managed to end the day in green, defending 23,500-mark and snapping its seven-day losing streak. This morning global cues are mixed. Wall Street ended mixed overnight, with Dow Jones snapping four-day losing streak. Asia-Pacific markets also started the day largely lower. Among stocks in focus, watch out for Adani stocks, UPL, and Dr Reddy's. Catch Lovisha Darad in conversation with Nirav Chheda, Assistant Vice President, Equity Derivatives & Technical Research- Retail, Nirmal Bang and Aishvarya Dadheech, Founder & CIO, Fident Asset Management.
